verses.kjv: Then I turned, and lifted up mine eyes, and looked, and behold a flying roll.
verses.ct: I looked up again, and there in front of me was a flying scroll.

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, What seest thou? And I answered, I see a flying roll; the length thereof is twenty cubits, and the breadth thereof ten cubits.
verses.ct: The angel asked me, 'What do you see?' I replied, 'I see a flying scroll — it's about 30 feet long and 15 feet wide.'

verses.kjv: Then said he unto me, This is the curse that goeth forth over the face of the whole earth: for every one that stealeth shall be cut off as on this side according to it; and every one that sweareth shall be cut off as on that side according to it.
verses.ct: Then he told me, 'This is the curse going out over the entire earth. According to what is written on one side, every thief will be removed, and according to what is written on the other side, everyone who swears falsely will be removed.'

verses.kjv: I will bring it forth, saith the LORD of hosts, and it shall enter into the house of the thief, and into the house of him that sweareth falsely by my name: and it shall remain in the midst of his house, and shall consume it with the timber thereof and the stones thereof.
verses.ct: 'I will send it out,' declares the LORD of hosts, 'and it will enter the house of the thief and the house of the one who swears falsely by my name. It will settle inside that house and destroy it completely — both its wood and its stone.'

verses.kjv: Then the angel that talked with me went forth, and said unto me, Lift up now thine eyes, and see what is this that goeth forth.
verses.ct: Then the angel who had been speaking with me came forward and said, 'Look up now and see what is appearing.'

verses.kjv: And I said, What is it? And he said, This is an ephah that goeth forth. He said moreover, This is their resemblance through all the earth.
verses.ct: I asked, 'What is it?' He answered, 'It is a measuring basket coming into view.' He added, 'This represents the sin of the people throughout the whole earth.'

verses.kjv: And, behold, there was lifted up a talent of lead: and this is a woman that sitteth in the midst of the ephah.
verses.ct: Then a heavy lead cover was raised up, and sitting inside the basket was a woman.

verses.kjv: And he said, This is wickedness. And he cast it into the midst of the ephah; and he cast the weight of lead upon the mouth thereof.
verses.ct: The angel said, 'This woman represents wickedness.' Then he pushed her back down into the basket and slammed the lead cover over its opening.

verses.kjv: Then lifted I up mine eyes, and looked, and, behold, there came out two women, and the wind was in their wings; for they had wings like the wings of a stork: and they lifted up the ephah between the earth and the heaven.
verses.ct: I looked up and saw 2 women coming toward us with the wind in their wings — they had wings like a stork's — and they lifted the basket up into the air between the earth and the heavens.

verses.kjv: Then said I to the angel that talked with me, Whither do these bear the ephah?
verses.ct: I asked the angel who was talking with me, 'Where are they taking the basket?'

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, To build it an house in the land of Shinar: and it shall be established, and set there upon her own base.
verses.ct: He answered, 'To the land of Shinar, where they will build a temple for it. Once it is ready, the basket will be placed there on its own pedestal.'
